reviews.review_msg: he is an amazing prof. he made lectures fun and worth while. assignments are just standard and not hard at all. I would recommend this class with him to anyone considering it

His teaching style kept me engaged throughout the entire lecture (despite the lecture being quite long) and made it so I could properly understand the material. Although the course I took with him was memorization heavy, he simplified everything so that it was easy to follow! I would love to take a class with him again!
He's the friendliest prof I've ever seen. I feel very comfortable around him.

Milad was very engaging. The lectures passed by quickly. However, expectations for assignments were unclear, in contrast to the very specific criteria that he used for evaluation, which was mostly left until end of term. Before taking this class (HSCI 485), you should know that grading was unpredictable and harsher compared to other HSCI courses.

The class content itself was very interesting, however, the grading scheme for the assignments is very unclear and there is too much information packed into projects with strict time constraints. This made it challenging to dive deep into the material and deliver quality work without feeling rushed.

I need what Milad takes before 3 hour lectures because he's always jumping around and making (non cringey) jokes and enthusiasm to keep things interesting and engaging. He always made it clear what is expected of us and he pulls quite a few questions from iclicker in the midterm and final. One of my favorite courses this semester!

He's so nice, I wanted to cry after my final exam knowing I probably won't be able to take another class with him since I'm not majoring in HSCI. His tests were fair, lectures were entertaining, and is just all around a great and caring prof. Brings in lots of guest speakers to give us different perspectives on topics we've learned in class as well

He's hilarious. The lecture is just under 3 hours, but he keeps the class engaged for sure. Expect lots of jokes, dancing, and performances. He uses iClickers so make sure you show up because it'll take out a chunk of your grade if you don't.

Literally the best prof! He keeps the class engaging for the full 3 hours with so many jokes, dancing and impressions. the hardest part of the course is the midterm but 20% of your grade is from clicker and you don't even need to get the right answer to get the marks. couldn't recommend this course enough!
The best professor
Best HSCI prof. Super enthusiastic and encourages questions. Lectures are content heavy but the exams are SO light.
lectures are fun, he is very caring and always making sure students understand the topic, exams are not supper hard
really nice prof would definitely take classes with him again!

Amazing prof!!! Took this course in the fall and loved his lectures. He always made sure everyone was engaged and made many jokes. Very few assignments, made exams fair(gave lots of hints and format of the test) and always asked for our opinions to make the class better. 100% would retake!!

Dr. Parpouchi is my favourite professor I have had at SFU. Incredibly knowledgeable and motivated about his field of study, and conveys this passion during lectures. Looks for participation and a willingness to learn, he isn't always looking for you to have the right answer, but rather to try and participate. Super manageable if you're engaged!

Milad is the best prof I've had so far, you can tell he's very passionate about teaching. His lectures are very engaging and he also has a great sense of humour which makes the lectures fun. I also found the exams to be fair because he's very open to students' suggestions and provides hints as to what will be on the test.

Favourite Prof by far! He's very engaging and you can get a good grade on exams if you do the work and study. He's very approachable and is always asking questions to make sure you get the most of the course!
Best prof ever.

Milad is my favourite. His lectures are interesting and hes funny and very knowledgeable and passionate. Hes so caring and open to discussion. 2 group projects and a presentation was rough but it is a seminar. Still super fun class and prof, take a class with Milad if you have the chance!

Milad is the best prof you will ever have in health sciences.The level of care and respect he has for his students is unmatched. Super funny with engaging lectures if you are interested in the subject. Multiple weekly readings and group presentations like most seminar classes but he makes you feel very comfortable to speak in class. 100% recommend!

Dr. Parpouchi is easily the best prof I've ever had. Lectures were extremely entertaining, he has an awesome sense of humour and had the whole class laughing every week. I actually looked forward to his lectures. Exams were fair and he gives lots of hints about what will be on them. Only downsides were lots of reading and he takes attendance.

HSCI 214 - Overall a really funny prof but lectures are boring. He reads completely off the slides and the only reason people go is because they need the attendance marks. The final was quite tricky, because there was a lot of material covered. Take this with him if you're okay with going to every lecture and tutorial!
Amazing prof! Engaging and cares about students. I actually looked forward to class
Great professor! Very enthusiastic about the course material. Fair exams and fun projects.

He was clearly good speaker and fun lecturer. Lectures are well organized and easy to follow. The required readings were however unreasonably too much. There are tons of readings other than the textbook. He says textbook is optional, but the contents ARE tested in finals, so be aware. This class may feel like an easy A course but exams were tricky.

Milad was a really good prof, he's very approachable and  helpful. The readings were useless in my opinion, they didn't appear on the Midterm but there was a few MC on them for the final. If you go to lecture, study the material and do the homework , a good grade is easy to achieve in his class!
Milad is a great prof.  He is very understanding towards students and makes lectures  fun.  Course material is pretty bland, however Milad keeps it interesting.

Best hsci prof at sfu. Keeps the class involved. That bring said there is alot of reading in this class. Also the final covers everything from the start of the semester to the end. Also keep in mind the class is scaled meaning there are only a certain amont of students who can get A's. So make sure your above the average of everything,to get an A.

Best prof I've had at SFU! iclicker for attendance, but Milad kept lectures interesting, except the last third of the semester when several profs came to lecture different topics (boring). Assignments and midterms were fair, but there was way too much expected for the final exam. Textbook readings were long and somewhat irrelevant, I didn't bother.

Great professor, young and passionate, though the course itself is not well organized but not his fault. The course is meant for HSCI student that covers a lot of materials, textbook is useless, midterms are fine, but final is just ridiculous, screwed up by the overload of information.
Milad, keep the lectures fun as you did this Spring semester!!

Milad was a great lecturer and kept things interesting. He was easy to pay attention to and encouraged questions. The textbook had little to do with what was taught in lecture, and yet is testable material. Midterms were fair but the final expectations are ridiculous as it is cumulative and there is a lot of content. Overall good class though.

Extremely helpful, very interested and knowledgeable in his field. He'd be the perfect instructor... if he didn't read off the slides. Also, his class requires too much unnecessary reading, 90% of which isn't even touched upon in lecture. Questions are encouraged in class, a little too much TBH. Sometimes pointless questions do more harm than good.

Milad was a good lecturer and was funny and engaging. There are iclicker questions in lecture, not for marks, just participationattendance, so try and go to class. He encourages students to participate in class  and is always willing to answer questions and help.  Lots of reading, but usually interesting material. Exams were fair. Overall, great!

young ,  funny professor but somehow he stopped giving lectures and old hsci department ladies start coming as guest lectureres.  Still dont know the reason  but it was  so boring . but Milad is very funny and helpfulguy so I loved  to go his lecture
